author: afdudley
content:
> <@!332923501079953409> what are the advantages of vulcanizedb vs graph protocol? can't seem to find anything on google.
<@!387536747476549632> Yeah, it's not really a public project, even if it's open source. They are actually very different models. From a pure code perspective https://github.com/vulcanize/eth-contract-watcher does the vast majority of what subgraphs do, but just using a TOML file instead of writing typescript. BUT we don't offer any free service, we didn't go through a huge community bootstrapping. we just wrote it as part of the grant the EF gave us for open source block explorer work.

VulcanizeDB is a framework/collection-of-tools that together allowing someone to develop and deploy their own third party verifiable cache/index of _any_ ethereum data, it's not limited to Events, like Graph Protocol is.

There are many advantages to using vDB over TheGraph, I think the main one is we can use vDB to index contract state without emitting events, which are expensive.
